channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2023090238
item.description:
Report X-2023090238

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED OF A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE LIGHT SLIDE. RESPONDER LOCATED PACKAGE NEXT TO SLIDE. UPON INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE HAD SLIGHT DAMPNESS ON THE CORNER. NO SPILLAGE ON SCENE AND TRANSPORTED PACKAGE BACK TO DMP TO PROCESS.

item.title: Report X-2023090237
item.description:
Report X-2023090237

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG SHE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HER IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON). RESPONDER THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA, CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY A FULL ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF CORRUGATED PARTITIONS AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 48 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report X-2023090175
item.description:
Report X-2023090175

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE BY THE PKG DIV SUPERVISOR AT THE BOXLINE-3 CLERK STATION. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND CONTACTED THE DMP. A RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 2 MINUTES, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY A FULL ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO SPILL THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report E-2023090691
item.description:
Report E-2023090691

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-06
  • City: HERCULANEUM
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver completed paper work on the QT app. Driver did do the math to make sure the load would fit. Driver stuck the tanks. Driver put cones out. Driver installed drop guns and hoses. Drop gun fitting wiggled side to side then popped up. Driver stopped flow and barricaded product so it wouldn't run down hill.

item.title: Report X-2023090227
item.description:
Report X-2023090227

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UPON CLEAN UP AND INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED 6 ONE QUART CANS OF RESIN SOLUTION WERE PLACED IN A REUSED CORRUGATED CARDBOARD CONTAINER. RESPONDER DISCOVERED CANS OF RESIN SOLUTION DID NOT HAVE CLIPS ON THE LIDS OR LABELS OF ANY KIND OTHER THAN THE COLOR OF THE RESIN HAND WRITTEN IN MARKER ON THE TOP OF THE CAN. THE CANS WERE WRAPPED IN BUBBLE WRAP AND PLACED INTO THE BOX. THERE WERE NO HAZMAT MARKINGS, ORIENTATION ARROWS OR ANY OTHER MARKINGS OR PAPERWORK ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE CARTON OR ON THE INSIDE OF THE CARTON. CONTACTED HAZMAT HELP DESK. SDS' WERE EMAILED TO THE CENTER FROM THE SHIPPER RESIN SOLUTION UN1866 PG III.

item.title: Report X-2023082018
item.description:
Report X-2023082018

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-26
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1.X-2023082018 SequenceEvent: Package was found in the HazMat hold area, repacked with a 15 scan attached. Labels were cut and taped on to corrugated cardboard. DescribePack: Loose caps tightened. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: Package was repacked which is not to be done with Haz-Mats. 2. X-2023090252 SequenceEvent: The package was found leaking inside a trailer as it was being unloaded from PD Doors. QA was called and we cleaned the spill with absorbant, placed the leaking Hazmat in a Hazmat bag and placed it in a tote. It was taken away from the area. DescribePack: Loose caps on one of the 5.0 liter containers DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Taken to a well ventilated area until processed

Report X-2023081956

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The Hazmat was found in the Awing of our facility, It was placed in a lined tote and QA was notified. DescribePack: 2 loose caps on 2 different gallons of solution caused the damage DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a plastic bag marked Hazardous and zip tied until it could be processed

Report E-2023090625

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of amerlack 600 resin (un1263) had been damaged by a sharp object and had damaged one of the inner one gallon metal one gallon can and had released 1 gallon of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023090063
item.description:
Report X-2023090063

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-27
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-C. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG EMPLOYEE EVACUATED THE TRAILER AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 1 MINUTE A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

Opening the box it was noted that a couple of the lids were loose. Not a whole lot of fluid came out but the box was very wet on the bottom DescribePack: two of the lids were loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was put in a plastic lined tote and placed in the hazmat cage
